text: my name is neil savil i am director of
software engineering at aws inside of
region services which is the
organization that i am a part of we run
global expansion for aws so what that
means is we build new data centers in
new regions and we grow aws footprint
across the world when i started aws i
was actually hired to figure out how we
were going to build one of the first
government clouds after that i saw that
the business was growing very quickly
and we were building more and more
infrastructure for the us government so
aws intelligence was a program that i
started about six years ago and what i
realized very quickly was we had to hire
staff at a rapid pace to help serve and
operate our government regions we stood
up this program and it was kind of a
training program but it was also to help
take folks that were not familiar with
government space and bring them into
something that we were building for our
government customers what we've done is
we've expanded this program quite a bit
it started with just 20 people and now
we have hundreds of people in the
program and we're continuing to
introduce new concepts new program
training capabilities and all kinds of
new things to make us more successful in
the future over the past nine years i've
been part of this amazing journey with
aws and we've grown quite a bit as you
can imagine we are just at the very
beginning as the private sector really
started using the cloud the public
sector is right behind we can allow the
government to move so fast faster than
they've ever moved before and as
technology grows and innovation grows
within our space we allow all types of
customers whether the public or private
sector to innovate very quickly so if
you're interested in the bleeding edge
of technology and working really closely
with customers to meet all of their
needs this is a great place
[Music]
